profile_positions.description:
After 3 years as head of production I am creating space for new and other activities within RDD and outside of the organisation. 
In my new role I focus more on the program of the Rooftop Routes, are responsible with the rest of the core team for the development of the program.Next to that I am still the person who is behind all the event permit related things for the organisation. 


The Rotterdamse Dakendagen believes rooftops offer the space needed for a better, more sustainable and more inclusive city in densifying cities like Rotterdam. We have chosen a festival as a means to accelerate the use of inner-city rooftops by using the temporary state of a festival to provoke durable change.
The Rotterdamse Dakendagen offers anyone interested in urban roofscape the opportunity to discover this on a scale (22.000 visitors on 65 roofs in 2019) that was not seen until now. The top of the city is discovered and celebrated by both the general enthusiast as the professional who is already working to develop the untapped potential of the city and thus to make the city more attractive. The Rotterdamse Dakendagen opens the door to the top of the city, and hopefully not only for those four days but the whole year through.

The next edition of the festival will take place 1-4 June 2023.
profile_positions.title: Programme, rooftops and permits

profile_positions.title: Head of Production, creative producer

profile_positions.description:
The organisation that wants to stimulate rooftop use in Hamburg with activities and knowledge exchange. You could call it the German sister of Rotterdamse Dakendagen. 

We open up rooftops (temporarily) for the public by organising events where we celebrate the rooftops of the city, and share the knowledge about these places.
Together we experience the finished projects and the ones under development. We also take them to the empty places to envision the future possibilities: we'll take you to a new level with cultural and architectural activities. 

Past activities (selection):
- Hamburger Dachtage 2022, with a rooftop-fox hunt, expeditions
- Lunch Dates  (during Hamburger Architektur Sommer) 
- Lecture series (i.c.w. HafenCity University Hamburg) 
- Auf die Dächer  ( design studio i.c.w. HafenCity Hamburg, Antje Stokmann)

-DE-

Das ehrgeizige Hamburg und seine Dächer
In Bezug auf Stadtentwicklung und Nachhaltigkeit ist Hamburg eine Stadt mit großen Ambitionen. Es ist eine Stadt, wo Raum gesucht werden muss, weil die aus allen Nähten platzt. Gleichzeitig gibt es auf bestehenden Dächern viel ungenutzten Raum, wo Ideen und Menschen miteinander verbunden werden können. Dächer regen die Fantasie an: Es gibt hier Raum für neue Perspektiven und sie zeigen neue Strukturen, die auf Straßenebene unsichtbar bleiben.
 
obenstadt e.V. ist die Organisation, die die Dachnutzung in Hamburg anregen will, indem sie Dächer mit inspirierenden Aktivitäten (temporär) für die Öffentlichkeit öffnet. Sie tut dies während eines Festivalwochenendes, wobei die Dächer der Stadt gefeiert werden und Wissen über diese Orte mit Besucherinnen und Besucher geteilt werden. Es werden bereits realisierte und noch in Entwicklung befindliche Projekte gezeigt. Auf die derzeit "leeren Dächer" können Besucher*innen Visionen und Träume für die Zukunft teilen. Hamburg Hoch lässt sie auf die Dächer der Stadt aufsteigen, und bietet neue Perspektive mit Kulturellen und Archtitektonischen Aktivitäten.
profile_positions.title: obenstadt - Founder & Boardmember  - Dachkuratorin (Rooftop Curator)

profile_positions.description:
"My work is about concept, research, making complicated things clear, and changing peoples view by being critical."

I am an editorial (graphic) designer who works in the field between design, research, and art.
Editorial graphic designer means that I am specialized in producing my own content for projects I work on, and that I work on the editorial process of the project as well. Therefore, research, content, and concept, are the most important aspects of my practice.

I often collaborate with other people: sometimes this means that I work together from concept till end product with other people. And other times the project stays mine, but I look for people with specific expertise for a project.

Specialties: 
Minor WdKA:editorial & research design. 
Extra courses: a.o. copy writing, type design, book binding
HTML, CSS, cms driven websites (e.g. wordpress)
research,society, cultural environment, political environment, photography. 

Worked on e.g.:
•Fragiele frictie|publication about exhibiting, art venues and artists|Contemporary Incidental Accumulation of Particles|Lokaal01|Breda, the Netherlands
•Contemporary Incidental Accumulation of Particles|groupexhibition|Lokaal01|Breda, the Netherlands
•Sculpture in public space|Wielwijk Fietst|Dordrecht, the Netherlands
•With new eyes/Grüße aus Berlin|audio tour/music cd/exhibition|Berlin, Germany
•Met andere ogen (audio tour)|expedition|Urban Explorers Festival 2011| Dordrecht, the Netherlands
•Greenlab|Lean Mean Green, Cultuur-Ondernemen|think-tank about sustainable business in cultural institutions
•Kalender Puttershoek, Puttershoek|research and production, Studio Annelys de Vet
•Homo Univerzamelaar|videowall|stadschouwburg Utrecht, Kunstenaars&Co
•8 uur overwerken, Nieuwe Garde Rotterdam|member organisation team (http://www.achtuuroverwerken.nl/)
•RO theater, Magazijn van het Geluk, Rotterdam|graphic design/publicity monthly event

profile_positions.description:
Tutor and supervision of Bachelor students during the semester studio"Auf die Dächer".
Research and organisation for the design semester „Auf die Dächer“.
Lead: prof. Antje Stokmann
 
The results of the semester were presented in the exhibition "Auf die Dächer" that we as tutors/professor coordinated and implemented. 
Next to this we also organised a lecture series called Auf die Dächer (cooperation with HCU).

Skills:
- Technical and organizational knowledge 
- Experience in the field of multifunctional use and design of roofs
- Local, national and international network in the field of multifunctional use and design of roofs.
- Teaching/ coaching

profile_positions.description:
My tasks at DordtYart were the daily and project management, co-programmer for extended program, pr/marketing. 

DordtYart accommodates modern and contemporary arts, not only in the form of exhibitions but also in the form of productions. Artists make use of studio spaces and there is also an artist in residence program. 
DordtYart not only offers its visitors the possibility to view art, it also allows visitors to get involved with the creation of art. By making the the artists and the process of creating accessible to the public, interaction is made possible.

For DordtYart three key issues play a central role, namely: art, audience and work. For the implementation of these three key issues, DordtYart has developed an integrated series of activities in her program. In addition to these three key issues, DordtYart will also be providing in the form of training, courses, and workshops (both for schools and companies). And will collaborate with different (inter)national institutions.

More information about DordtYart on: http://dordtyart.nl
profile_positions.title: Manager

profile_positions.description:
[Dutch] 
Sense of Music
In 2017 zoekt DordtYart met het klankbodempaviljoen de grenzen op van het paviljoen: naast typische paviljoenconcerten zoals het repetitieve repertoire van componisten als Simeon ten Holt, Franssens en Charlemagne Palestine, uitgevoerd door o.a. Rondane Kwartet, Ralph van Raat en Ivo Janssen, hebben we o.a. Slagwerk Den Haag, Huygens Vocal Ensemble (koor), harpist Remy van Kesteren en bijzondere experimenten en muzikale ontdekkingsreizen van Sounding Bodies en Brigitte van Hagen.

Klankbodempaviljoen
Het klankbodempaviljoen is een uniek muziekpaviljoen gebouwd zodat muziek optimaal tot zijn recht komt. In het muziekpaviljoen hoor je niet alleen de muziek; je voelt de muziek. Dré Wapenaar, de kunstenaar achter het klankbodempaviljoen, heeft met dit bijzondere podium een unieke ruimte gecreëerd, waarbij de akoestische ervaring centraal staat: de resonanties zijn in en om je. Muziek wordt zo een totaalervaring waarbij speciale aandacht is voor zowel de muzikant als de toehoorder qua akoestiek.

Dit klankbodempaviljoen is gemaakt in DordtYart, met de première op de landtong van DordtYart, in 2012. Het paviljoen is opgedragen aan componist Joep Franssens, In zijn werken maakt hij gebruik van de klankregisters van alle bespeelde instrumenten. Met name zijn composities voor meerdere toetsinstrumenten dienden als inspiratie voor dit paviljoen. Lees meer over het klankbodempaviljoen van Dré Wapenaar op zijn website.
profile_positions.title: Program developer & creative producer of < Sense of Music >

volunteer_experiences.description: Board member of the Broodfonds (Dutch safety net organisation for business owners and freelancers) I joined.

In de periode dat ik werkte voor Takecarebnb is de organisatie enorm gegroeid, wat vroeg om een professionalisering en andere structurering van de communicatie zowel intern als extern bij de organisatie. 

Als lid van het communicatieteam heb ik me onder andere bezig gehouden met:
- Herinrichten van communicatiestromen intern en extern, professionaliseren van de communicatie bij de organisatie. 
- (Her)ontwerp van de website, zowel de front als backend (i.s.m. een collega). 
- Onderhoud van de website, zowel front als backend.

VoorleesExpress stimulates language development of childeren and enriches the language environment at home. We enable parents to stimulate language development of their children - in their own way.
(Volunteer position)

More information about VoorleesExpress (in Dutch): http://voorleesexpress.nl/wat-we-doen/waarom-de-voorleesexpress/
